metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9915 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An access issue existed in Content Security Policy. This issue was addressed with improved access restrictions. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8, Safari 13.1.2, iTunes 12.10.8 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.3, iCloud for Windows 7.20. Processing maliciously crafted web content may prevent Content Security Policy from being enforced.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9915` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.28.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.28.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.28.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.28.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.28.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.28.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.28.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.28.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
